manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: POPMAS Adjustable (-45 to +45 Degree) Metal Angle Mount

Angel Mount facilitate your life Our angle mounts will give your doorbell the proper angle which you need, It's still excellent video and the mount does not skew it at all, this mount is a great addition to the Ring Doorbell. This is a great add-on to easily angle exactly where you need it to be.

Easy Installation Easy to assemble with the detailed Installation Guide and all necessary accessories,which enables your installation to be completed within 10minutes. You can use the existing holes from your Ring Doorbell Original. Installation Step Firstly fix the bracket on the wall; Secondly tighten it with a screwdriver and a wrench; Thirdly fix the angle; Finally lock the door bell with screws.

With & Without the angle mount view scope display With our angle mount ,it's much better view and vision with the adjustment, especially when you use the angle mount in order to see down and get an excellent view of the walkway, the front yard and all the way out to the road.

Adjustable with Angle Scale Angle Mount allows you to adjust the angle from left 45 degree to right 45 degree. Make your adjustment more easier and much time saved.It is perfect to improve your motion detection and have a good view of visitors. Good view of visitors It is perfect to improve your motion detection and have a good view of visitors. Now you can angle to see who’s coming up the driveway. High quality material Sturdy and durable: made of metal with stainless steel screws.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: great overall mount. easy to adjust and holds on strong.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for tight situations
reviews.reviewText: Not much to add, except that the kit also includes a rubber grommet to protect the wires that come out of the doorbell, should you choose to hard wire your RING doorbell. In my case the casing around the door was too narrow and was hard against a brick wall. By using this mount we were able to easily attach it as the mounting plate is about 1/3 narrower than the back plate of the Ring. I did end up using more robust anchors, but that was my call, the ones they provided were adequate. We were also able to bend the linkage a bit so we could tilt the camera upward as our original doorbell was installed low, by doing so we get better face pictures and the doorbell works fine and rings the inside chime. The metal itself is powder coated steel and is of a robust gauge. I am very satisfied with the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works perfectly for Ring 1
reviews.reviewText: This mounting bracket worked exactly as advertised and came with all the necessary tools and hardware. Granted, I used a better screwdriver (the one which comes with the Ring itself) and a power drill to make starter holes. Was a simple/quick install. My only initial concern/complaint would be the mounting bracket itself (the small square you screw into your house) wasn't level to the portion that holds the Ring, so I had to mount it to my siding slightly angular to have the Ring be level when attached. Not a big deal since nobody can see it. This is why I am giving 4 stars, however.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars what I needed
reviews.reviewText: Works great just as described for ring doorbell 2nd generation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ring 1 Angle Mount Works for Ring 2nd Generation
reviews.reviewText: I'm writing this review to share that I ordered the Ring 1 Angle Mount for the Ring 2nd Generation. There was some confusion in the reviews as to whether the Ring 1 or Ring 2 was appropriate for 2nd generation. The answer is, the Ring 1 is the proper fit.This mount is sturdy easy to install. Unfortunately, I had to return it because I didn't have enough flat space to mount it with the decorative trim around my door.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only Solution for Narrow Door Trims I’ve Found
reviews.reviewText: This baby works, and it’s the only solution I’ve found for narrow-trim doorways and installing Ring’s enormous video doorbells. In my situation, I wanted to put it over my existing doorbell and use the wires. The normal Ring bracket just wouldn’t fit. I thought about only using battery power, but the stone veneer around my doorway would have been difficult to work with, and I wasn’t about to mount this thing on my door.My doorway trim gave me about 1.8 inches of real estate to work with. As an additional complication, part of the trim bulges up and isn’t flat. While this bracket wasn’t small enough to fit only on the flat portion of the trim, it was still small enough for me to install well within the 1.8 inches and account for angled screws due to the bulged portion of the trim. I was then able to feed the wires through the bracket, connect the wires to my Ring doorbell, and install Ring’s bracket on top of it. Worked like a charm.A couple notes:1) Some people have mentioned being unable to tighten the screw that controls the bracket’s ability to angle the doorbell side-to-side. Because they can’t tighten it, the doorbell moves easily after they get it at the desired angle. This is because the nut that holds the tightening screw in place spins when they try to tighten the screw. You can fix this by ensuring the nut doesn’t spin/move while tightening. To do so, you could use needle-nose pliers to hold the nut, or the box-end of a combination wrench. I believe I used an 8mm wrench to hold the nut in place while tightening, and now it’s tight.2) The big bracket that Ring provides you, that you will eventually screw into this bracket, has a magnet on it (at least, mine does). This magnet supposedly helps hold the doorbell in place while you screw the doorbell into Ring’s bracket. Overall, the magnet is unnecessary, and in my case the magnet kept messing up the placement of the bracket since the magnet would move where Ring’s bracket wanted to sit (this bracket is metal). You can easily pop the magnet out of Ring’s bracket and throw it away. It is held by some adhesive, so you’ll have to pop it out with the flat-head wrench or something similar.3) The rubber grommet to help cover exposed wires is a nice touch, but doesn’t really fit too well and isn’t very flexible, so it’s hard to work with. If your door area is covered, I wouldn’t worry too much about the wires, and you can always cover any small wire holes with electrical tape. I was able to make the rubber grommet work by cutting off the end of one side.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars DOES NOT FIT RING 3 as stated in the description
reviews.reviewText: I spent a lot of time trying to make sure this was the right one to fit my model of Ring doorbell camera. Because a LOT of reviews seem to be about different models of the same mount for different camera models. So in finding this one, that says IN THE TITLE that it is for Ring 3, and it used a picture of the same model I have, that this mount would actually work.Went to install it today and NONE of the screw holes line up. NONE! Not even the top two... or maybe only the bottom two... not even left or right line up individually. Because it is a cheap piece of crap, I figured I'll just drill my own holes and make it work, which I did. At this price it wasn't worth my time returning it and trying to find another one to fit that most like would also NOT fit.DO NOT RECOMMED as the description DOES NOT match the product as delivered.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved the product but the angle wasn't helpful on my front door. My stairs are on the side of my front door and the angle didn't help me.
Decent product, easy to install, but way over priced.
